result.execSummary:
The defendant William Kyler Lafferty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA Sample.
Comply with any mental health treatment plan and any other assessment/treatment ordered by Probation.

timeConds.notes: No huber allowed. Jail time to commence if court costs are not paid in full.

9:08 15CM74 and 15CT50 heard at this time. Defendant William Kyler Lafferty in court with attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 20 jurors are seated. Court calls the case. All jurors are sworn. Court does general voir dire of the seated panel. 9:56 Atty OSullivan voir dires panel. Atty Amann voir dires panel. Attorneys make 4 strikes each. 12 jurors are selected and swn.10:25 Jury is excused. 10:56 Court resumes. Jury, Attorneys and Def present. Court gives preliminary jury instructions.11:08 Atty OSullivan gives opening statement. 11:19 Atty Amann gives opening statement.  O'Sullivan calls River Falls Police Officer Paul Jensen.  Jensen is sworn and takes the stand.  O'Sullivan examines Jensen.  Jensen identifies defendant.  O'Sullivan - Ex #8, informing the accused. Offered/received.   Exhibit #1 - CD, offered/received.  Audio portions (both part one and part two) of Exhibit #1 will stand without court reporter recording it.  Break for lunch at 12:00 p.m.  Resume at 1:00 p.m. 1:03 Court resumes with Jury, Counsel and Defendant present. April Shuneson swn, ex by Atty OSullivan. Exh#7-- blood draw anaylsis; off/rec. Atty Amann x ex. OSullivan redirect. Officer Jensen retakes the stand, Amann continuing to x ex. Exh#20-google map of area; off/rec. Atty OSullivan redirect. Exh#2,3,4,5- photo of Officer Jensen's injuries.  Exh#2-5; off/rec.  Atty Amann re x ex. 1:47 Officer Ryan Hansen swn, ex by Atty OSullivan. Atty Amann x ex. 1:53 Deputy Chase Westfield swn, ex by Atty OSullivan. Atty Amann x ex.  1:55 Kristen Drewieck swn, ex by Atty OSullivan. Exh#6-Laboratory Results; off/rec. Amann x ex. OSullivan redirect. 2:34 Jury excused. Court recesses. 2:48 Attorney and Def present in court.   Constitutional rights to remain silent are explained to defendant   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights to remain silent.  Def elects to testify. State's rests. 2:51 Jury is present. William Lafferty swn, ex by Atty Amann. Amann plays DVD/CD (3:35-3:45).Exh#21- recording; off/rec.  Atty OSullivan x ex. Deputy Chase Westfield retakes the stand, redirect by OSullivan. 3:59 Testimony is closed. Court goes over jury instructions: 100, 115, 2669, 1765, 1230, 1400, 190, 300, 200, 140, 160, 460, 484, 515, 525. Verdicts: OWI, PAC, Resisting, Battery to Peace Officer - guilty and not guilty to those charges. Attorney has no objection to instructions or verdict forms. 4:06 Court recesses.4:20 Court resumes. Counsel, Def and Jury present. Court instructs the Jury of the law. Atty OSullivan gives closing argument. Atty Amann gives closing argument. OSullivan gives rebuttal. 5:02 Court gives final jury instructions and verdict forms. Bailffs are swn. 5:07 Jury is excused for deliberations. 5:08 Court recesses. 6:02 Attorneys, Defendant and Jury present. Foreperson states a verdict has been reached. Court reads the verdict: guilty of OWI and PAC (15CT50), Resisting (15CM74), not guilty to battery of a peace officer (15CF123). Jury is polled and state that is their verdict. Court reads closing instructions to the jury.  6:09 jury is excused. Attorney and Defendant. Court: remand Def to the custody of the sheriff, without huber or home monitoring. Scheduling clerk will contact attorney's to schedule a sentencing date.

8:45 15CM74 and 15CT50 heard at this time.  Defendant William Kyler Lafferty in court with Attorney T Gregory Aman. Attorney Rory Osullivan in court for the State of Wisconsin. This was in chambers. Court goes over witness list. OSullivan states one witness will not testify. Amann has no additional witnesses. Amann request witnesses be sequestered. Osullivan requests Court Service Officer Jensen be exempt from being sequestered. Amann objects. Court exempts Officer Jensen. Court will gives standard voir dire. Court: seat 20, 4 strikes. Defense agrees the State does have to prove prior convictions and prior convictions will not be discussed. 9:00

9:05  This hearing  includes 15cM74 and 15CT50  Judge Duvall appearing by video conference. Defendant William Kyler Lafferty in court with attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No agreement has been reached. The trial is on the OWI, Resisting, and Battery charges.  Witness lists have been filed by the state. ATty Amann addresses his witnesses.  OSullivan states that a body cam video will be used and there is not any objections to any part that needs to be redacted.  The defense will stipulate to the 2 prior offenses. Jury instructions will be sent to the attorneys from the Judge via email. Trial will only last 1 day instead of 2  The date if 2-16-17.

9:05 Defendant William Kyler Lafferty in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM74 and 15CT50 heard at this time. 9:22 This includes 15CM74, 15CT50 Defendant William Kyler Lafferty in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Thorie states the last offer has been rejected.  The OWI may be resolved separtely.  15CF123 and 15CM74 are still pending. OWI will have to be a plea today. Thorie states the plea cannot occur until the defendant has been on electronic monitoring for 60 days and he can be admitted in the IDIP program. Judge states this will stay on the trial calendar. Court states the trial date stands. Court will give the attorneys until May 10, 2016 to work something out.   Court discusses witness lists. Other acts are not being brought in by either party. Priors are discussed -  no stipulation at this time so can be put in front of the jury. Voir dire issues - none. Jury selection - no special issues.  Trial length is 2 days. Presentation of evidence video?Audio? Redacting necessary? Raise any issues regarding this before the trial.  By May 10 the attorneys are to exchange what they intend to play and what portions. Blood draw - no issues.

3:38 Defendant William Kyler Lafferty in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appears with Def, via phone. 15CT50 heard at this time. Court reads charges and penalties. Def waives further reading.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty to charges in 15CM74 and 15CT50. Court enters not guilty pleas.  OSullivan requests a $1000 on each bond. Nelson: no objections. Def was in the Army discharged in 1992.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
